title: Recovery from an eating disorder in the United Kingdom ( UK ) 2015 , by disorder
summary: This grouped bar chart represents 3 different Categorys on X-axis for 2 groups Anorexia nervosa, and Bulimia nervosa. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of individuals.
Out of all 2 groups, Anorexia nervosa had the highest Share of individuals in Category Full recovery and Anorexia nervosa had the lowest Share of individuals in Category Chronically ill.
In Category Full recovery, Bulimia nervosa had the highest Share of individuals among all 3 Categorys and it has the lowest Share of individuals in Category Chronically ill.
Category Full recovery and Chronically ill had the biggest gap of 22.0 between the highest and lowest Share of individuals found for Bulimia nervosa.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 3 different Categorys on X-axis for 2 groups Anorexia nervosa, and Bulimia nervosa. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of individuals.
Out of all 2 groups, Anorexia nervosa had the highest Share of individuals in Category Full recovery and Anorexia nervosa had the lowest Share of individuals in Category Chronically ill.
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 3 different Categorys on X-axis for 2 groups Anorexia nervosa, and Bulimia nervosa. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of individuals.
Out of all 2 groups, Anorexia nervosa had the highest Share of individuals in Category Full recovery and Anorexia nervosa had the lowest Share of individuals in Category Chronically ill.
In Category Full recovery, Bulimia nervosa had the highest Share of individuals among all 3 Categorys and it has the lowest Share of individuals in Category Chronically ill.
Category Full recovery and Chronically ill had the biggest gap of 22.0 between the highest and lowest Share of individuals found for Bulimia nervosa.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of individuals on the Y-axis for 3 different Categorys for 2 groups Anorexia nervosa, and Bulimia nervosa that are presented on the X-axis.
Out of all 2 groups, Anorexia nervosa had the highest Share of individuals in Category Full recovery and Anorexia nervosa had the lowest Share of individuals in Category Chronically ill.
Among all the Categorys, Bulimia nervosa had the highest Share of individuals 45.0 in Category Full recovery and lowest value 23.0 in Category Chronically ill.
There is a gap of 22.0 between the highest and lowest Share of individuals found for Bulimia nervosa in Category Full recovery and Chronically ill.
Among all 2 groups, Anorexia nervosa had the gap of 26.0 between the maximum and minimum Share of individuals observed in Category Full recovery and Chronically ill respectively.

On average, the Category Full recovery had the highest Share of individuals for all 2 groups Anorexia nervosa, and Bulimia nervosa. Whereas Chronically ill had the lowest average Share of individuals.
